website_summaries.verdict: This beginner French set is geared toward preschool and elementary kids, but many older siblings seem to enjoy and benefit from them, too.
pros: Beginning French set for kids ages 3 to 8
Includes 10 French easy readers on themes common to kids
Also provides online/MP3 access to recordings made by native French children for pronunciation
cons: The price is high for small paperback books, but the additional audio content is extremely valuable

customer_reviews.title: Good quality French education
customer_reviews.text: We love these! My husband speaks French only with our kids and I was looking for a way to help our 7yo start reading French and to expand our 19mo's vocab. These were perfect on both counts. Only complaint is at $25 was a little pricey for paperback but the quality is there in another way I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lebold

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: It has been fun to use these to learn a bit of French with my children as we study France together. The pictures and books are nice, and I am thankful for the site where you can read along with an actual French speaker so that you don’t have to guess what the pronunciation is like. Warning, however, sometimes you will hear a word said one way by one reader, then another way by another reader. I think it’s a matter of accent, though. Like City girl vs. Country girl, if you know what I mean. Same language, different intonations.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Deane

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves the English set, so I bought the French to see if he could try another language at the same time. He really likes going back and forth between the two languages and is picking up new words in both English and French! He likes the audio and e-books a lot too!
customer_reviews.author: Cristiany F.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and fun
customer_reviews.text: A nice little series of books that are short, simple and perfect for a small child. However, I purchased them for me to aid in my French studies. They are nice for that too.
customer_reviews.author: GlennaOctober

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Children to Learn French
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. You download the story and it reads the book to your child.
customer_reviews.author: Ihntgds

customer_reviews.title: Prefer Duolingo
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really care for this. I think my daughter found it confusing. For the website where you access the audio, I thought that they were speaking too fast and that there wasn't much explanation. My daughter has much preferred duolingo.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: My children (ages 5-12) and I love these books
customer_reviews.text: My children (ages 5-12) and I love these books! The stories are both fun to read and to look at. The linking of vocabulary words in color to the same-colored illustration really makes the words come to life. We can read these over and over. Highly recommend them to anyone interested in learning a new language!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little readers learning another language
customer_reviews.text: The set overall is great for my 5 year old boy who has taken to learning French. The theme of each book in the set is a nice touch and the pictures are super cute. I like how each book cover has the translation for the main words you'll be reading along with the translation per page. The only reason I removed a star is because one of our books has the wrong book cover attached so the translations don't match up with the story. That was disappointing. I would like to have this corrected so my little one can have the translations attached to the book.
customer_reviews.author: tim Craycraft

customer_reviews.title: He loves it
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is learning 2 languages at 2 years old!. This series has him so excited and we converse in this language
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Superbe
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little series. My kid loves it. Very educational and a great bargain for the material. Trying to raise a bilingual kid, it is difficult to find as many books in French as English.
customer_reviews.author: grrosie

customer_reviews.title: We enjoy them
customer_reviews.text: My 10 and 8 year old are enjoying these books. Their French tutors also liked these
customer_reviews.author: Ocean.to.ocean.with.love

customer_reviews.title: Great French language instruction set for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, well thought out books. The storyline is easy to follow, and the illustrations are simple, engaging and fun. Loved the fact that the books have an online audio version. Highly recommend the books and looking forward to more sets.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Resource for Language Instruction!
customer_reviews.text: These little books are terrific- clear and instructional with great illustrations that are extremely appealing to look at. Highly recommend for teaching young kids French!
customer_reviews.author: SKR

customer_reviews.title: High quality French books
customer_reviews.text: My children love the stories and are learning French words at the same time! They really like the audio too, which comes with fun sound effects.
customer_reviews.author: PV

customer_reviews.title: Good book for little kids learning French
customer_reviews.text: Really helpful books for my son. The story is fun for little kids and good vocabulary for French beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Catsinee A.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and simple
customer_reviews.text: Cute little booklets. I bought them for fun, for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Paige Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised, quality and value for money. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Rudich

customer_reviews.title: Worth your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! Our kiddo who's 3 is already reading and identifying words and their corresponding nouns and images in French and we only got the books yesterday!! He keeps wanting me to read them over and over. Now he's identifying the words himself! My husband is also learning from these books as well! Lol <3
customer_reviews.author: Ava_78

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: We homeschool and have been studying French for a couple years, but needed a vocabulary refresher. My children really enjoy these and the QR codes are quick and easy to link to the audio (so much easier than CD's).
customer_reviews.author: Zuzu

customer_reviews.title: Parental  involvement is required in order to benefit from this method of learning.
customer_reviews.text: This product was bought for an 8 year old boy who began learning French three weeks ago. I hoped that the books would motivate him and make his studies more exciting.The books and audio have been stimulating and have kept his interest. I thought the books would be larger but the content appears to be suitable for his age.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: French for Kids: 10 First Reader Books with Online Audio and 100 Vocabulary Words (Beginning to Learn French) Set 1 by Language Together
